text: From tap at MBCC 2017. A hazy orange coloured beer with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, fruit, grapefruit, citrus, spice and with a bitter finish.

330ml bottle from Tallink Silja. Murky golden/amber, long lasting white head, good lacing. Fruity and hoppy aroma, pale malty, peach, citrus and passion fruit. Dry and crisp mouthfeel, medium carbonation. Bitter and citrus zesty taste, grapefruit, tangerines, passion fruit, peach, bread, wheat and pale malt. Long floral bitter finish.

Tap, sample. Tasted on the 13/05/2017 at MBCC (Copenhagen). Hazy golden colour with a medium white head. Aroma of fruity hops, pine, grass and spices. Taste is medium hoppy and fruity with a malty and slightly watery finish. Next one please!
MBCC. Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and rather hoppy - fruity. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Sweet and rather bitter finish. 130517
Sample at MBCC 2017. Hazy golden with a white head. Fresh with hops, some citrus, grass and malt. The body was medium and the finish bitter.

On tap at Vrteka 2017, Belgrade. Shared with Vinja 666. Hazy yellow to golden, lasting offwhite head. Herbs, mostly mint, very nice, like a herbal candy with slight licorice and anise aromas. Great balance, on the hoppy, bitter side. Medium body, moderate carbonation, great finish. Excellent use of hops!
From tap. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is peachy and slight citrusy. Bitter, slight fruity, mild herbal. Lingering dry and solid hoppy. Fruity and peschy, grapefruity finish.

Draught at MBCC 2017, green session. Hazy, golden colour with a medium sized white head. Fruity aroma with hops oils, fruits and a spicy hint. Taste is bitter. Medium bodied. Finishes dry and bitter. Excellent Lager

Tap at MBCC 2017. Pours hazy golden. Hoppy, citrus, pine, grass. Sharp bitterness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Vrteka. Murky amber body, white head. Fresh blasts of hoppiness create the aroma, tropical and herbal. The taste balances everything out, a good neutral maltiness backs up tasty, lighter tropical and herbal notes with a solid bitterness. Relatively simple, very much effective, and definitely a superb IIPL.

Appealing, hoppy aroma. Beautiful, aromatic hop flavor with a long, bitter finish. Full body, medium carbonation. Nice!

Appearance: golden, amber, hazy, white foam, rocky head, lasts. Aroma: citrus, passion, mango. So Fruity! Bread, sulphur. Taste: medium sweetness, lightly sour, medium bitterness. Palate: light waterish body, thin feel, creamy, average carbonation, bitter, long finish,

Bottle. Pours hazy golden with medium sized lasting head. Aroma is really nice, hoppy and floral, packed with tropical fruits, mango, citrus, tangerine. Taste is quite bitter with grapefruit, pine, resin, hops and some grass, balanced by malts and caramel. Medium body and average carbonation. Very nice.

330ml bottle. Very fresh, just bottled. Pours hazy orange colour, medium sized white head stays. Massive tropical aroma - mango, orange, pineapple, banana. Resin hops, some pine in aroma. Very rich taste, bittersweet, juicy, tropical. Spicy and sticky hoppy aftertaste. Some alcoholy notes. Medium to full bodied, average carbo. Abnormal beer, this enormous amount of hops make it so enjoyable.

UPDATED: APR 10, 2017 This is lager?!?! Whoaaa....
This beer is out of this world. It competes easily with best IPAs, but it is Pils... This is purely genial invention. I simply love this beer.
Pours hazy, dark golden liquid, with medium white top.
Aroma - hops, grapefruit, spring flowers, blackcurrant and mango. 
Taste - bitter, but at the same time light and refreshing, altough hoppiness hits hard like a sledgehamer. But the bitterness is balanced by a slightly sour side taste and it gives a real grapefruit and tangerine mix with hints of spruce wax. And then tere is a subtle taste of malts somewhere... Really-really nice and warm feeling as it goes down. Again - ABV feels almost non-existent, making it a quite cunning drink :)
Aftertaste - hoppy, fruity and bittersweet. Aftertaste is strong and lasts for at least ten minutes, then it slowly fades away leaving a bit peppery memory.
Well, it is one of the best hoppy lagers out there IMHO. Juicy, refreshing and crazy.
On tap at BBF. Hazy golden colour with white head. Fruit, pineapple aroma. Fruit, hoppy, slightly astringent taste. Light to medium body.

On tap, @BBF 2017, Barcelona 26/03/17
Color amarillo buena corona de espuma blanca, el sabor es herbal con un final seco.
Nice, clean taste. Hops seemed too bitter by themselves, nothing to balance out.
Clear dark yellow, white lacing foam head. Strong hoppy aroma and super strong bitter in taste. Long bitter aftertaste. GREAT. (Velp 201702)

Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, orange, pine, grain, hops, citrus and grapefruit.

Appearance:

Opaque golden/amber beer with a slight/medium off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, orange and pine; ends slightly/medium bitter and dry with grain, hops, citrus and grapefruit.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Absolutely unfiltered greatness, creating a lot of grain and hops for an IPL. Amazing for its style, this is how I imagine it.
Bottle. Hazy light amber color with white head. Aroma - Tropical fruit, caramel, malt, pine. Taste - Bitter, light sweetness, grapefruit, malt, tangerine, caramel, pine. So smooth. Almost perfect.

(Tanker Hallucination) Bottle 330ml at home, served into a shaker, ABV 7.6%
Bright orange coloured body, mostly clear, with a tall and thin white head on top, average retention.
Aroma of pine, orange peel, tropical fruits, grassy hops, peach.
Taste has lots of tropical fruits, very notable hop presence, grapefruit, peach, grass, orange zest, mildly bitterness.
Medium body, good carbonation, quite dry on the palate.
Very good.
bottle. hazy, golden, white head. aroma- lots tropical fruits. sweet and juicy and bitter, medium body, bit sour. nice
Draught (Drink, Tallinn) - Hazy amber in colour. Grapefruit, peach and ginger in the aroma. Hoppy taste with grapefruit, peach, ginger and apricot.

Draught @ hop Artisan. 
Hazy golden color with a thick white head. 
Tropical fruity, juicy hoppy aroma. 
Fruity, citrusy, oranges, hops. Fresh and fruity, nice bitterness. Awesome.
Вкусное пиво. Похоже на IIPA. Хороший вкус и приятны& аромат, а так же горькое продолж& послевк& Хмеля не пожалел& пивовар& Срок годност& до 29.09.17. (Bottle 0,33/ 7,6%)

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2016 A very biased opinion: Ithink this is the best beer there is, 
for someone who enjoys the taste of hops in a good ipa. Its an imperial pilsner by name, but has the kick of hops to stay with the best of them. I have at least one every time i go out for craft beer.
What a lovely Friday finish  aroma is overwhelming rich of  you name it. Taste is bitter but I love it. For me its just the right kind of drink. Enjoyed every sip of it.

Bottle
Aroma-grapefruit
Appearance-golden, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good
Bottle. Уellow, cloudy. Aroma: pleasant hops, juicy tropical fruit, citrus. Taste: juicy, hops, fruit, citrus, candy canes and grassy.

Poured from the bottle. Probably the best Ive tasted from Tanker. A very bitter (in a good way) strong hoppy lager with some sweet tropical fruit going through it. Lobely aroma and taste and a good longlasting aftertaste. Great!
Bottle shared. Rich grapefruit juice character, really smooth and delicious! Great example of that style, clearly a hop field killer brew :)

Hazy orange beer with nice head on top. Aroma has lots of sweet fruits and grapefruit hops, then passion fruit and more sweetness. Taste has lots of sweet fruits, passion fruit, and some bitterness. Medium body and medium carbonation.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Tap in Ota Olut! Well balanced. Lovely tropical fruits. Passion. Not too bitter. Mellow and pleasant.

Bottle. Pours light in colour with white head. Aroma is malty and frutiy. Medium sweet, quite clear taste with hoppy citrusy notes. Medium body, moderate carbonation, finish has bitter grapefruit in it and is quite bitter. Alcohol quite well hidden.

Bottle shared. Thanks Raul! Pours a hazy faded, orange juice gold with a finger of white foam. Huge white grapefruit nose that goes on. Some light tartness present and a touch of funky cheese (in a good way). Well-balanced but definitely light and quaffable. Bitter finish, with pithy grapefruit notes. Was diggin this one quite a bit.

Pours whitish creamy with some white bubbles on top. Aroma is grassy and hoppy, some green apple aromatics. Taste is full of grapefruit, very hoppy, yet superbly drinkable. I guess that is how a proper IPL should be done.
Dry hoppy nose, grassy, some over ripe papaya. Dry, aggressively bitter, very well balanced. Big dry bitter finish. Excellent IPL.
12oz bottle at Wirre pours a murky gold with frothy white head. Nose is grassy, herbal, mild pepper, some muddle lychee and other fruit. Flavor has lychee, grass, straw, perfume, lemon. Zippy finish.

Sampled at Van Moll Beer fest. A bit unclear yellow to light orange color, medium sized off-white head. Smell and taste malts, huge hops, fruity, hoppy, softly floral, floral hoppy bitter finish. Nice!
Tap at drink bar, tallinn. Hazy orange color, white head. Aroma has fruity notes, malts, hops. Nice malty body, hops, dry hoppy notes.
Bottle 33cl @ Drink bar & grill. Pours hazy orange with a very small head. Fresh pine, citrus, grass in the aroma. Sweet, bitter, citrus, pine in the flavor.

Hazy orange color with small head. Aroma has lots of tropical fruits and grass. Taste is fruity with long bitter aftertaste. Flavors of tropical fruits, malt, citrus, pine.
A small taste from a friend @ One Pint Pub. Pours hazy golden with a high head. Aroma is malts and tropical fruits. Flavor is creamy malts with fruits, pine and hops. Great.

Whoa! Lager on steroids. Very fruity and resinous but still dry and fresh and recognizable as lager. Let's have another!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Biernavigatie, batch 062 BB 26 12 2016, large sample. Slight hazy golden color, medium frothy head. Aroma has lots of grassy hops, citrus, grapefruit, slight cookie. Piney bitterness in taste, bit grainy malt. Quite dry, slight alcohol. Bit sticky in the finish. Not as clean and crisp in taste as I would like. Aroma is wonderful though.

Aromat intensywny, owoce tropikalne, trawa, grejpfrut, igliwia. Kolor złoty, mętne. Piana średnio obfita, drobna, średnio trwała, zdobi szkło. W smaku lekka słodycz, średnia pełnia, owoce tropikalne, zboże, trawa. Goryczka średnia, wysycenie niskie.

from Erzbierschof - cloudy orange beer with a chaotic foam left; hoppy aroma of mango and peaches; full-bodied, lively and quite sticky, bitter and long aftertaste of bitter oranges, mango and apricots

Bottle at home. Aroma is fresh fruity hops, citrus, orange, tangerine, grainy malt, tropical, grapefruit, hint of pine. So much fruitiness... Flavour is light sweet and nicely bitter. Body is medium. Remarkably juicy and drinkable, a big pleasant surprise this uberhoppy IPL.

BOTTLE at Drink bar, Tallinn. Packed with juicy tropical fruits, tart and bitter grapefruit pith, a touch of malts sweetness. Massive flavour, massive yet smooth grapefruit pith and zesty bitterness that totally dwarfs the malts. Excellent.

Thanks to boss Ben @ Beerlvovers Bar! Draft: Hazy golden, huge white head meaning this beer was a bitch to pour. Nose is massive bitter grass, crazy big fruit, oily grapefruit peel, lovely rich. Taste is dry bitter oily grapefruit peel, rich fruit, zest, citrus, low beautiful cheese hop qualities, so rich & awesome, creamy. Very delicious brew. Color me impressed, I hope to try more from these guys. One hell of an IPL  took it for a DIPA.
At Beerlovers bar. Pours unclear blonde, huge white head. Smell is dry,malty. Hoppy, very aromatic. Orange-like hoppyness. Taste is bit bitter, refreshing. Hoppy, somewhat grassy. Aromatic. Nice
Bottle from Tallinn. Hazy yellow with medium head. Yellow fruits, crispy bitterness. Fresh full hoppyness.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

11th June 2016Very hazy gold beer, good cream colour head. Palate is light, semi dry and has a fine minerally crispness. Thin malts bring mild creamy sweetness. No pils character here, drowned under the wonderful hop onslaught. Piney start in to a nice medium level of hop spice. Good tropical fruits. More hop spice on the semi dry finish. All flavours in great balance. Lovely fruity spicy piney beer. Just not a lager!

Tap tasting @ Barboteur Beer Days # Brussels 2016

Hazy in appearance, but the aroma.. this is something special - fruity, floral and overhelming.. the taste is not that bitter at one would expect from aroma, but there is a strong bitterness which comes and comes in aftertaste

Draft @ Barborteur Beerdays #1, 14.5.2016.
Dorée sur léger voile orangé, col épais crémeux blanc-cassé.
Arôme au nez mettant en avant une base houblonnée très conséquente, surprenant pour une pils impériale, nez super résineux, pin et agrumes en retrait, on en oublie quasi le malt pils et la levure.
Palais est sec et bien houblonné gardant assez déléments pour rappeler une pils. Cependant, le houblonné est conséquent, superbement bien résineux et pin plus les agrumes, petite touche de maïs en fin de bouche avec une levure lager qui se prête bien au jeu.

Hazy yellow colour, small white head. Aroma of citrus, malt, tropical fruits, pine, hops, some herbal and floral notes. Dry sweet taste with medium bitter finish and hoppy aftertaste. Medium body and average carbonation. Pretty good lager.

Hazy yellow ochre, big creamy white head. Sweet and freshly fruity, mild pine, caramel malt, light soapy tone, red berries, mango, tangerine. Nice. Sweet and mildly bitter, medium body, standard carbonation, dries bit to grapefruity-piney finish. Very good, nice aroma and pure flavors, quite sweet, balanced, easy to drink.

330 ml bottle at home thanks to VamboladeTolly. Hazy orange color with nice white head. Hoppy and light malty aroma, citrusy fruity, orange, tropical fruits, grassy, light pine, caramel. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Tap at TCBW2016. Hazy yellow color, small white head. Aroma is malty grainy with notes of gooseberries. Light-bodied to medium-bodied. Fruity malty, lots of gooseberrish hops, citrus. Nice hoppy lager.

Looks dark orange with a bit of haze. Crazy fruit burst on the nose. Hops dominate the taste entirely. Fruity hops with citrus. Bitterness is surprisingly reasonable and the overall mouthfeel not at all resinous (considering the total amount of hops of course). Lager characteristics only appear in the aftertaste, otherwise its hard to tell. Close to zero carbonation and a decent malt base to handle all the hops. Strong hop forward lager, I need a glass of water.

W aromacie głównie tropiki z naciskiem na ananasa, poparte rześkim cytrusem i leciuteńką siarką, która gdzieś się tam pałęta, ale nie przeszkadza. W smaku ananas dominuje, dochodzi lekkie mango, całość jest rześka i bardzo pijalna, goryczka średnia. Charakteru lagera ni chu chu. Gdyby nie siarka byłoby wyżej, ale i tak jest bardzo dobrze! Thanks @rosenbergh!

One of the pleasant surprises @ Metenis. Decent malt background with quite a hop bomb, mostly grapefruit, pine, herbal kick, some tropical fruits. Liked hop cocktail. Light sweetness with moderate bitterness. Quite dry.
Very nice
Lovely long drink. Dry bitterness that builds up. Could be cleaner for a lager yeast. Aroma no surprise is intense. Bit too harsh.

(Bottle, 0.33 l - BB 30/10/2016, thanks Marduk, at tiongs tasting, 20160109) The beer poured golden and hazy. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had resin, somethin soapy and white bread. Palate was medium bodied and a little bit warming with medium carbonation. Flavours were resing, something soapy, sweetness, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was mainly bitter. A pretty good but a bit too stingy brew.
Hazy orange body, white head. Aroma has tropical fruits, caramelly maltiness, pineapple, some orange and carrot. Quite sharp and pungent flavour. Alcohol in background. Floury palate.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2016 330 ml bottle. BB 30/10/2016. Courtesy of Marduk.
Clear golden color with a small off-white head.
Sweet fruity hops, tropical fruits, mild bitterness and some maltiness in the aroma. 
The flavor is strong hops, fruitiness, mild resin, moderate bitterness and nice dankiness. Tasty. 

Rerate: 330 ml bottle. BB 28/12/2016. (Rimi) Rakvere, Estonia.
Hazy golden color with a small foamy white head. 
Dry fruity hops, peach, passion fruit, sourness, tartness, bitterness and some balancing malt in the aroma. The flavor is strong hops, tropical fruits, grapefruit, passion fruit, resin, moderate bitterness, dank and some balancing malt. Absolutely great IPL. Super tasty. I could drink this every day for three months. Maybe I will.

330ml bottle
Pours dark orange with a small white head. Aroma of hops, herbal notes, grass, pine, resin, caramel and loads of fruits. Taste is hoppy, malty and grainy with loads of herbal notes, grass, pine and resin. Finish is heavily hoppy, grassy and herbal with some malts and earthy notes. Quite hoppy and heavy. Tasty.
Bottle at tiongs, Espoo. Thanks to Marduk! Colour is cloudy orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, hints of caramel, hops, some hints of alcohol and malts. Pretty good.

Pours bit hazy, brown. Aroma feels very classical - some hops, citrus, pineapple and yeast. Taste is sweet and bitter at the same time, some notes of vanilla, cinnamon, berries. After is quite bitter and heavy. Quite good one, but little bit too predictable for me.

Bottle. Batch 039; BB 30.10.2016. Pours a hazy orange with a small off-white head. Massive oily-resiny-piney-grapefruity aroma, with a softer side to it too, like ripe fruits, and then some pungent and spicier notes. Tastes of all the aforementioned stuff, but its unexpectedly soft, smooth and seemingly well-balanced - only later, in the finish, does the almost extreme grapefruit seed bitterness kick you in the nads. Overall a bit extreme and unrefined, but as a hybrid style, and together with the silly label and deScription, it works surprisingly well. But no way Id guess it to be a lager. Will try it again soon.
Lovely beer all around. Aroma, body, texture and the taste. It completely resembles BrewDog Hoppy Christmas form 2-3 years ago.

33cl bottle at Kohvik Retro, Kuressaare. Pours slightly hazy orange with a white head. Strong and fresh citrusy aroma with notes of tropical fruits, caramel and hints of pine and herbs. Moderate to medium sweet with strong hoppy flavours, but still feels balanced. Finishes with a solid bitterness. Really tasty and refreshing IPL, one of the best Ive tried.

Bottle. Hazy orange body, medium to low head. Aroma has big fresh fruity hoppiness with mango and pineapple. Nice. Quite sweet fruity and malty taste with tropical fruits. Only the resinous hop oil offers some balancing bitterness. Alcohol is well covered. It really reminds me of all these tropical-tasting and overhopped Mikkeller pale ales. Nice rebound after the Surf Wax horror. Its impossible to tell that its a lager. Its clear that a new category for very hoppy lagers is needed here, as everybody knows that the "Imperial Pils/Strong Pale Lager" style mostly represents high alcohol pilsners and often modestly hopped strong pale lagers. No connection here.

Tap. Cloudy orange color. Huge size, thick white head, stays. Looks delicious. Fresh tropical fruits, mango, sweet, citrus and dirty yeast in aroma. Viscous sweetness, packed with fruity citrusy hops and light hints of berries in taste. Hits you with a hammer! Tastes nice, but hops in aftertaste is harsh. Heavy body. Soft carbonation. Extreme brew.

Dark, golden yellow. Thin, white head. Really nice fruity aroma. Apricot and spices in first taste. Citruses and some tangerine in aftertaste. Hoppy, suprisingly light-bodied, medium carbonated, very well balanced, really nice and tasty drinking beer.

bottle 0,33 @ Gambrinus.
dark yellow color. strong hoppy, floral aroma. veru hoppy taste, alchol is noticable. interstristing brew.

Rated pe 18.12.2015.bottle. Amber, hazy unfiltered. Really intense hoppy aroma, filled pretty much the whole room with a citrussy grapefruity green berry, piney fragrance on opening. Med bodied, bitter, but still drinkable, balanced enough. Feels robust. Pale malts, but mostly hops. Resinous finish. Really nice, intense hoppy drink. Cant find much lager in it, but dont care either.-- bb

hazy amber liquid with white head. Aroma of blackcurrant leaves, fried salty food. Taste blackcurrant leaves, grapefruit, medium sweet, heavy bitter, light sour. Medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, long finish,

Bottle. Hazy pale-ish amber beer, medium to small white head. Nose is a big hit of hops, resiny-fruity notes, pine, oranges and grapefruit, mango. Flavor is a heap of hops, more pine resin and oranges. Finishes with lots of grapefruit and yet more resin. This is the resiniest lager Ive ever had, its a bit silly, but it works. Naturally the pile of hops cover up the booze pretty nicely, although there is an inkling of the ABV in the finish and aftertaste.

Orange color with small white head. Wow, the aroma is over the top hoppy, fruity and piney. Taste is also overwhelmingly hoppy, fruity, flowery, grassy. Has to be the hoppiest beer on the market. Huge hit of bitterness yet still easy to drink. Truly magnificient beer

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2017 pours hazy orange with small head. aroma is full of citrus and pine, tropical fruits, grass and hay. taste is heavy bitter, pine, resin, grass. medium body. long bitter finish. If you like that your beer is bitter then you love this one.

Tap at koht. Pours golden with whiteish head. The head doesnt stay. Aroma is hoppy, citrus, grapefruit, mango. Flavor is sweet, hoppy, citrus, grapefruit, raw hops. Finish is citric bitter. Feels oily. Overall: good.

Hazy yellow pour with 1 finger of white foam. Massive aroma of citrus fruits, passion fruit, peach, orange and some dank fresh grass. Explosion of hoppy flavors in the mouth- mainly orange, citrus but also getting some sweet malts. Oily and sticky mouthfeel that coats the mouth with hoppy goodness. Low carbonation which helps hops and malts come through. Lager yeast makes this beer easily quaffable and lets the hops take the stage. Awesome!

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2015 Tap (Koht, Tallinn) (5:3:5:3:10=2.6)
Big hoppy aroma, fruity and sweet, fleshy fruits. Quite musky, sweaty, even BO. Pretty potent and pungent in the mouth. Clear alcohol, and pungent stanky hops. Sweet, and a little sticky palate. A bit over the top and silly, but drinkable.
Rerate: 330ml bottle (Drink Baar, Tallinn) (6:4:6:4:13=3.3)
Much better. Bold bombastic hopping, fruity. Taste ditto. Has a balance to it, despite the over-the-toppiness. Cleaner hopping, less stank. I dont even like over-hopped beers, but I cant fault this at all - congratulations! Rerates are good!

Totally new style for me - India Pale Lager. And imperial. Hazy in appearance, but the aroma.. this is something special - fruity, floral and overhelming.. the taste is not that bitter at one would expect from aroma, but there is a strong bitterness which comes and comes in aftertaste

Pours a deep gold color, with nice carbonation that provides a white head. Aromas of citrus, grapefruit, fresh flowers and nice lager malt. Taste is glorious. Lovely harmony between the lagered yeast and the hops. Very bold flavor. A nice crisp, dry finish leaves me wanting more. Great beer!
Huge aroma of ripe pineapple and passionfruit. Light body with lots of hop oils. Bitterness is powerful and fruity, Citrus, and grassy. Tons glong on here. Unique and awesome beer.
Draught at Brewdog södermalm. No head. Clowdy golden color. Dirty hop aroma. Big tart bitterness.
